intro: Phlox variabilis subsp. variabilis, commonly known as the variable phlox, is a perennial flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. It has linear to lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. This species is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
